Reviews.Title: “Could be better, but was satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: jermtheworm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for over two weeks whilst on business in the area. Upsides: Friendly staff, laundry facilities, good air con, location and ease of parking. Downsides: insufficient kitchen utensils, room cleaned once in 2 weeks and internet (additional charge for & wireless) very slow and unreliable. Overall, best to eat out if possible or bring your knives, forks, plates etc with you. I saw or smelt no problems with pets to be fair, unlike some others.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: ehmarcus
Reviews.Content: Don’t expect luxury at this price range. The guests appear to be “blue collar” types rather than business people. First the good: Price is reasonable. Front desk staff are friendly. Parking is easy. Wi fi works well. Rooms are good sized. Can walk to nearby restaurants. The not so great: room serviced only once each week. Extra charge for kleenex and toilet paper for “long term guests.” Sound proofing is non-existent – can hear both parties on a phone call in the next room. (And I’m a little deaf.)

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tango037
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a dump. Deriorating property, filthy carpets, baseboards coming off, alarm clock doesn't work, charge for local calls to many prefixes, unreliable Internet service, bad smells in common areas. Kitchenette stocked with with ONE fork, ONE spoon, ONE bowl, ONE plate, and a single frying pan! They allow DOGS, and there is dog poop all over the place. The hallways smell like dog. Non-smoking room had cigerrette burns all over it.. Don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION AND GREAT SERVICE!!”
Reviews.Author: chrisca562
Reviews.Content: We booked this room through Priceline, and with Priceline you never know what you are going to get. My wife and I were very happy with the hotel!! We were in town for the Chargers/Broncos Monday night game so the location was perfect. 1 mile to the stadium. The front desk was extremely helpful, allowing us to check in before the posted 3pm checkin time and helped us with the taxi phone number. The room was nice and neat, everthing was in working order and for the price it was perfect. Im not sure what people expect when they stay in hotels? People complain just to complain! Complain about everything. This place had everything you need in a room, fast food and walmart, convience stores, pizza etc within 1/4 of a mile away. Quiet, easy parking great air conditioning. You are close to all the San Diego attractions too. Within 15 minutes of sea world the zoo and 35 minutes to the casinos such as Harrahs... I thought the place was great!! If you want 5 diamond resorts people, don't expect to pay 35 dollars on priceline... cheap people who complain make me sick!!! thank you extended stay for the great visit, too bad the chargers lost again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Near-Perfect Member of this Budget Chain”
Reviews.Author: mike110742
Reviews.Content: I usually get hotels in this chain as 2-stars on Priceline, for $30-40 depending on season. I booked this November 5, 08 for May 09: $38 plus Priceline fees. PLUS: Spotlessly clean room and hallways and property, amazing customer-service front desk teamwork, $1-wash, $1 dry laundry; guest or staff left unused laundry and dish detergent in laundry room, a thoughtful gesture and what a GREAT idea and model for others. Flawless one-flat fee phone and internet, one $4.99/stay. Sparsely furnished with dishes and utensils; I asked for a frying pan and got one immediately from Jonathan, described to me later as "the maintenance manâ€� a smiling youngster in mid-20s who understands the notion of attitude-free teamwork and should get a big raise. The chain should train all its employees in this concept, which harms no one and creates all kinds of good willâ€”jump in when you are needed. Bedding and seating in rooms updated and (unlike Homesteads, part of the same group, with sheets that donâ€™t fit and roll you up inside them if you move during the night. Ample quick-flow hot water. Starbucks and Walmart close by, I-15 close by. Blackout drapes and a curtain on the closet are good ideas. COULD IMPROVE: Internet while reliable is a reliably slow connection: â€œhighâ€� speed = 30-45 KB/sec, about a tenth of home service and sometimes an irritant. No hangers in closet. Impossibly expensive vended beverages and candy: go to Walmart.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: SDPam
Reviews.Content: The front-desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The room looked recently renovated and was nicely decorated, clean, and quiet. However, it had a very strong fishy smell left over from the previous tenant's cooking which unfortunately stayed with the room during our entire four-day stay. I reported two safety issues our first night there -- the room's deadbolt wasn't working, and a light bulb was burned out at a back hotel entrance which made it hard to use the key entrance after dark. The deadbolt wasn't fixed until our last day there, and the light bulb still hadn't been replaced when we left. There was a one-time $4.99 charge for internet. Thankfully I wasn't on a business trip that required work on my laptop because the internet connection was terrible. It would continuously pause, then lose connection, then reconnect. I checked my email several times a day and had this problem every time. For a personal trip, I would definitely stay here again, but next time will "preview" the room to check for weird smells and to verify the deadbolt works. I probably woudn't stay here if traveling on business because of the internet difficulties.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable place to stay for a few nights”
Reviews.Author: sulitster
Reviews.Content: Booked this stay thru PRICELINE so I did get a lower rate for the Labor Day weekend. A little bit afraid before arriving at this hotel because of the previous postings for this hotel but when I arrived I found that things are a lot better than I imagined. The grounds are well kept and maintained. The lobby is a bit small but served it's purpose of checking in and welcoming guests. There is only one elevator but didn't have to wait too long every time I have to use it. I found that my room is clean enough for me to sleep. I didn't find any hairs in my bed or pillows. Did not find any traces of any stains on the sheets as some postings would suggest. The rooms have a small kitchen as this hotel chain primarily serve the long term stay clients. There is a full-size refrigerator, microwave, toaster, electric burner and basic utensils. Although I find it strange that they don't have any pots and pans to use for the electric burner nor having some sort of complimentary dish washing liquid to wash the plates and utensils that I did use. I had to resort to using a bath soap to wash them. I also think that they should have at least double the number of towels in the bathroom and have extra bed linens and pillow cases as there is no housekeeping provided if you are staying less than 7 nights, even then it is only once a week. Daily housekeeping is only provided if you pay a fee. The interior of the room definitely needs to be updated as it seems to be stuck in the early 90's. I have stayed at a different Extended StayAmerica property and it had the newer style furnishings seen on the hotel reservations website. I also find that since the carpeting all over the hotel is of the stain resistant type and is of dark color they most likely use it as an excuse to not periodically steam clean them to get the stains out. A properly cleaned carpet goes a long way to making the rooms smell much better than when I walked into it and it smelled like the typical LYSOL disinfectant odor. Despite the complaints I have with this hotel I still think that this is a much better place to stay than say Motel 6 or some other budget priced accommodations as those type of establishments , in my opinion attract the undesirable members of our society. So will I recommend this hotel? The answer is yes, but keep in mind that this is not the Ritz or a Marriott so don't expect it to be one.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, bad facilities”
Reviews.Author: tech88920
Reviews.Content: I would NEVER recommend this hotel or hotel chain to anyone. Customer service at this place is a joke. Arrived at the hotel around 10:15 pm and found no one at the front desk except for a housekeeper that spoke broken English. The front desk person had skipped out 45 minutes early! The room had hair in the bed and on the pillows. The room door wouldn't lock, so it could just be pushed open without using the card key! No other rooms were available! Housekeeping lady couldn't get a manager on the phone... said she was on vacation. Only one manager for this whole hotel? And no one to fill in while she goes off on vacation? Finally she got a hold of the front desk person at home, and she came back in to work in her pajamas and her body was practically covered in tattoos. Still, they had to get me a room at a (worse) hotel much farther away, and they didn't even offer any compensation. This is the second Extended Stay America I've been to and now I know NEVER to stay at one again. The business model must be to do as little as possible to get by. The staff are the kind of people you would find working at a fast food place in a low income part of town. The company is a disorganized mess and that's reflected in the upkeep of their hotels and the careless way in which they treat customers.

Reviews.Title: “The Mark of Mess”
Reviews.Author: guyinca
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find this hotel as they are a bit down the road and only have a small sign, but if you drove right by you might be thankful you did. I know the hotel doesn't claim to be The Ritz, but it should at least be clean! I pulled the blanket back last night to see a skid mark on the sheet. So I got a new sheet from the front desk, but that meant I had to make the bed. That's why I saw the green gunk on the headboard below pillow level, the brown spots on the wall, and the innumerable stains on the mattress itself. Topping it off, the bed was so hard one could hardly sleep on it. I had booked the hotel on Priceline for two men, but when I got there they only wanted to provide one bed. I had to pay an extra $20 for the second bed...the reason given? The cost of cleaning linens!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal but some uneasiness”
Reviews.Author: Desertkitty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located off I-15, a few miles north of I-8. It was easy and fast to get on and off the interstate. It was nice not having to travel on congested I-5. Many businesses within a block or tow: A Pizza place, Chinese restaurant, and Mexican fast food are within walking distance in a strip mall. There's also a lot of fastfood, starbucks, gas stations, within a few blocks. Hotel Lobby was quaint and nicely decorated. Very clean. Check-in was fast. Elevator was very slow. The room was roomy. small kitchen with full size fridge, microwave, stovetop, toaster, coffee maker, dishes, pans, cups nad glasses. I did not use any of the dishes because I didn't see any dishwashing liquid. How do I know they are clean? The bed had a hair. PIllow had a hair. I was afraid the linens were not changed from the previous guest so I had a hard time relaxing. I also gross out easily at the site or thought of someone else hair in my things and because I had just eaten dinner, had to run to the bathroom to puke. The bed looked clean but I still wondered if the linens had been changed. Slept alright considering the bed was firmer than I am used to. The TV volume did not turn down all the way so it was louder than I would have liked it to be. Worried about disturbing the neighbors. Bathroom was clean. Towels were thin. And guess what?...another hair! Ugh, my towel had a hair weaved into the terry cloth soooo, I puked again. I had a hard time getting the courage to open the other towels. No hair, but puked again because I was thinking of the other towel...and the pillow,...and the bed. Check out was fast. Personnel were pleasant. It was an ok visit. I wish I could have felt at ease about the cleanliness of the room amenities. Since I booked through Priceline, I couldn't take my business elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for long stay if you need a kitchen & living facilities”
Reviews.Author: jetlagnow
Reviews.Content: This is a good place to stay if you need to have a kitchen and you are going to be staying longer than a week. Otherwise, it would be less of a hotel and more of an apartment type space (not big on decor or hotel-type luxuries). For the long-term rates and the ability to have a full kitchen though, it was great. Would recommend to families who are staying in the San Diego area for an extended period and who want to save on costs (on a budget). Drawbacks were: the grounds are very bare bones (they feel more like a corporate building layout than a comfortable place to live or walk around). There were also groups of immigrant day laborers that were living in some of the rooms and they tended to be noisy at times. But the staff are nice, the place is clean and if you need home amenities (living area) then it is a great choice. Would give it a B+ for that.

Reviews.Title: “YUK!”
Reviews.Author: California Sun
Reviews.Content: Thank goodness it was for only one night. First room was dirty, hairs on sink, tub, bathroom floor & mirror like a dirty cloth was used to wipe down area, bed sheets had hair and dried food on plates in cabinet. For some reason there was a map of Kentucky on the mirror by the bed that housekeeping did not remove. We got this room because the guy at the front desk said since we got it on priceline we had to take a smoking room, and since this room was dirty and unacceptable we got another room a little better but still the furniture and carpet was dirty and stained. The bed was the pitts, hard and very uncomfortable. The staff was very limited. The first desk clerk was not in uniform and cocky. The second gal was helpfull and changed our room. priceline or not we are still a paying customer and that should have not been an issue of our stay for what kind of room we received. Plus we did pay $80 with tax for this dump. $65 was my priceline bid. We normally get much better rooms for this bid in this area.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: rippowam22
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights thru Hotwire. I paid $22 per night, which is an unreal price. Location: About 20 mins to downtown, not too bad. About 5 mins from a variety of shopping (Walmart, McDonalds, Starbucks, Supermarket, etc). About 10 mins to a huge shopping center (IKEA, Restaurants, QualComm Stadium, etc). A few blocks from Highway 15 exit. Located on the edge of a small office park, not on a busy road. Overal Property: Elevator smelled, stairwells not great, full trash rooms, semi-dirty carpets, two of my four rooms had toilets constantly running. While it felt safe, this property is at least somewhat geared towards folks staying by the week (or longer). Rooms: Spotless, that's great. Some room noise from slamming metal doors (depends on your neighbors). I switched rooms after the first night because I had two rooms of construction guys constantly coming and going right next door. The next TWO rooms I was given had problems with the toilets (couldn't flush and constantly running). My fourth room was upgraded to a king and was in very good condition. No shampoo, no maid service (one time per week), small kitchenette. Also, some of my four rooms had a recliner, a coffee maker and a clock radio, some did not. Don't depend on any of it. Staff: They were fine, but as you might suspect, there is limited staffing. Overall: For $22 I can't complain too much. It WAS clean and convenient for my needs. If you're going to a Chargers game, it's a great location (one exit down the highway). The King room I was given was A-OK. Just be persistent if something is wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Homeboynot
Reviews.Content: I got this on a Priceline bid for a low price. It's a great place right off Highway 15 a mile or so from Mission Valley and a good central location if you have a car. Large room with complete kitchen including normal size frig. Great shower/bathroom. Good room layout with elevator and center hallway which meant on the third floor we could leave our window open and have fresh air and privacy since the window didn't open onto a hallway or walkway. Wireless Internet is only $5 for your entire stay. In house laundry room. Only problems were smoke in room from prior occupant, small TV and maid service only once every three days (but that saves money). You can get fresh towels at the front desk. Free parking too although you do have to make a U-turn on a four lane road to get into the place. Very close to pizza parlors, fast food, Wal Mart and Frys.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I arrived at midnight, and all was in order for me to get my key since no one is available for check in past 11 pm. It was all very secure. However, when I got into my room, I wondered if they'd made a mistake and given me a room that hadn't been cleaned. Hair on the toilet, 4 long black hairs on the shower wall, hair dust balls in the corners of the bathroom, and many splashes of dirty drop marks strewn across the bathroom mirror. No, no mistake I soon realized, for the toilet paper had been folded in that unmistakable little "v" that tells the room has seen the maid. I found it rather disturbing. But my final word is this: I'll stay again, no matter the dirt. The walls were very solid, and although a family came careening down the hall speaking very loudly as I entered my room (and they entered next door to me), I couldn't hear them through the walls. As another reviewer mentioned, the hotel is in a boring part of San Diego, which is why I chose this area. I wanted sleep, and I got it every night. The area is safe as well. I recently moved from San Diego after having lived there all my life; I knew where to go where few tourists would venture, but where it was safe and pleasant to walk with lots of stores close by. I found the kitchen facilities to be adequate, but nothing spectacular, and yes, I did find the room depressing. There was little style or decor, but hey, I was interested in sleeping, so it was easy to overlook the flaws. One thing that could cause issues for some - I was in a non-smoking room, but the other end of the hall was smoking. I was the second room from the end furthest away from the smoking rooms, yet, opening my door felt like I was entering a Vegas casino at 2am, smoke seemingly billowing in on me. I'd open my door real quick and close it right away, then rush down the few steps to the stairs holding my breath. There was no ventilation at all in the halls. However, the individual doors to the rooms were sealed very well, for I never even got a hint of smoke when inside the room. So it wasn't bad for me, but if you're sensitive to smoke, this might be a deal breaker. Overall, I found the hotel to my liking, despite the flaws. If you're looking to get some good sleep, this place might be the place for you. It was for me.

HotelInfo.Name: Extended StayAmerica San Diego-Mission Valley
HotelInfo.Address: 3860 Murphy Canyon Rd, San Diego, CA 92123
